page.title: 15Warslow Band and Guides
page.content: {Warslow Community Brass Band} meets in the school building every Monday and Wednesday at 7 o'clock. There are 16 members of the band, mainly young people. The instruments played include the tuba, baritone, tenor horn, trombone, cornet and trumpet. At the moment the band play for their own enjoyment but, they hope to play in public in the future. {The Warslow guide pack} was formed in 1982 and has 10 members and two leaders. They meet in the school hall on Fridays from 6.45p.m. until 8.15p.m. Their time is spent playing games, working for badges or going on hikes. The pack has a link with the Ashbourne guide pack with whom they go camping every so often. To raise funds for the pack and for charity, the guides have coffee evenings and sponsored events.
